Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Lonstarhusker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights starting on 4/6/2012. The prior reviews pretty well reflects the hotel. The location is great, the price is affordable, the staff courteous and the accomdations and bath clean. We had a 4th floor room and we were aware previously there was no elevator in the hotel. That got a bit tiresome after a few days. The solution to that would be to ask for a lower floor room. We were also, from prior reviews, aware of the need for breakfast reservations so that was not a bother. The breakfast was simple but the coffee was really good. Since breakfast came with the room, it was not overpriced. On the downside, the beds were hard and there was no visible A/C except for a window.Overall this is a very good hotel for the price and fit our need very well.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Cheerio9
Reviews.Content: Room ok, bathroom ok, good location. Poor service, terrible breakfast. Stay somewhere else in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Timing is everything!”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: We were 3 friends from Denmark staying at the Arenula. Hotel is well-situated - the hotel and its rooms are basic but clean and well worth the reasonable price for the location. Some guests were unaware that they needed to reserve a half-hour breakfast slot. Others arrived later than their slot and/or stayed too long. Considering the limited space - and the hotel's attempt to be efficient - we would encourage guests to be considerate: come to breakfast on time and leave no later than your slot's end. Thumbs up for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and near the centre”
Reviews.Author: smiliestef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in February 2011, it is basic but comfortable and in great location near to everywhere you want to see. Once arriving at the airport, it was really easy and cheap to get a train to the centre It did take us ages to find this hotel by foot, but was due to us arriving in the dead of the night. The breakfast was good and full of choice,the hotel was clean, and quiet when we stayed. The weather was gorgeous which made the stay even better. I would recommend staying here is you want to visit everything Rome has to offer with a comfortable, great location hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Placement, placement”
Reviews.Author: JR-Jelling
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Arenula - and had a nice stay. The location is just fantastic with very short distances to Campe de Fiori, Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Piazza Venezia. Morning breakfast is a bit of a hustle - but taken into consideration the number of romms - the system with prebooking is better than having 50 persons stamnding and waiting for their turn. It is funtioning - almost all the time - but remember - this is Italy - and you are staying at an Italian 2 star hotel - not the Marriotts and Hiltons of this world. Some reviews (older) state that the front desk is unhelpful - but we had no experience of this. Rooms are nothing special - OK for class and price.

Reviews.Title: “Best at the Price”
Reviews.Author: Terpander
Reviews.Content: The Arnula is centrally located in Rome's most interesting neighborhood - two black from the Tiber, five blocks from the Pantheon, six from the Piazza Navona - and so extremely convenient. It is also well run, clean, friendly, and helpful. The breakfast is excellent. Because it lacks an elevator, it cannot charge high prices. If you don't mind stairs, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: The Arenula Hotel is just minutes from Campo de' Fiore, The Pantheon and Piazza Navona. With convenient bus service to the train station and other parts of the city, it is my choice location. This is definitely a budget hotel with an entrance up a flight of stairs in an older building and larger rooms up another flight or two. This was my second stay and I prefer a room on the same floor as the lobby, although it is very small and has a tiny en suite bathroom with just a basic shower, sink and toilet. The staff are polite and some are extremely helpful and knowledgeable, especially Rosanna. A full breakfast is included and there's access to BBC World news on the room TV.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: NellBaker
Reviews.Content: The location of this Hotel was nice because it was central to the major sites (Vatican, museums, major sites). It was about a 15-20 minute walk from the train station which was far with our bags. However, everything in Rome is far :). The room was average but did have a lot of space to hang or put away your clothing if you are staying a while. Breakfast was included. You had to sign-up for a time slot the day before and show up during your slot but it seemed to work pretty smoothly and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: sanibal
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, near the Tiberina Island, and trastevere, the location is nice, you have nice restaurants in "portico" street. Good value, large rooms...Quiet. negative aspects are: some little tasty breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Reception deck was not a RECEPTIVE!”
Reviews.Author: sks61
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all I expected...no elevator, medium priced, small rooms, clean and comfortable. Could have not asked for a better location. However I did not expect to be treated with "distain, rudeness and unfriendly clerks at the reception desk. I stayed 5 nights and still couldn't warm up to them, even though I tried to always say "good morning and evening in Italian. It was VERY obivious that we were an intrusion to them. However I do believe in giving praise where it is due and Dominic was a jewel! He worked several evenings and was the only reception person that was kind, smiling and helpful. Thumbs up for Dominic!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: CityHopper123
Reviews.Content: Small located in the 'Jewish Ghetto". Great for the traveler who wants to be near kosher restaurants. Centrally located to the sites. Front desk wasn't too nice, depending on who was there. On our last day, the new desk clerk was pretty helpful. No elevator, good a/c, decent breakfast. They did have free access to computer w/ internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location . . . terrible front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Lovetraveling42
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. However, the terrible front desk service from every clerk (with the exception of one) made this hotel stay very painful. We attempted to be pleasant, but it got us nowhere. We weren't asking for anything special . . . just the essentials and it was so painful for the staff to help us. They are there to sit and watch the entrance and nothing else. "Do not ask questions . . . figure it out on your own" is theyr motto! The rooms were clean, but not made for lounging in. It is a good budget hotel. The breakfasts were excellent and the two gals that prepared the espressos and served the breakfasts were sweethearts. They were charming, friendly and lots of fun. No elevators, so plan on climbing lots of stairs. Good exercise, however, not if you have lots of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: Becky006
Reviews.Content: This is a place to stay if you just want somewhere to sleep, shower and leave your belongings. If you plan to spend any time in the hotel, then dont stay here. It was clean, basic and close to all you'll want to see, including the Forums and colosseum. Its a walk to the vatican city too. In fact, its a walk everywhere, I doubt you'll need a taxi. (- tip, make sure you ask the price first, unless you are coming from the airport in which case its a fixed 40 euro price) Rome is full of scooters so bring earplugs if you sleep lightly, its also quite echoey and you'll hear people in the room above etc. Breakfast was fine, nothing special but had what you'd expect - coffee, tea, fresh croissants and fruit / cereal. The staff are very helpful and go out of their way. Just one more tip - dont pose with the plastic armoured centurions at the attractions...they'll walk up to you and say 'take a picture' ... then they charge you 5 euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good and centraly located”
Reviews.Author: Norwayfamily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times since 2006 at this basic 2 star hotel situated in an area where you can walk to all sites in central historical Rome. The rooms are clean and simple, the beds can be some hard, but it's ok. Their breakfast is good, with fresh rolls and croisants, as well as lots of realy good coffee. At our last stay we had a large 4 bed room on the first floor, we will soon be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SeanSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Arenula because of it's location which is superb, OK the hotel is a little basic but is very clean and great value, air con was brilliant, staff were very friendly, breakfast was great, I would definitely recommend this place to others, when we arrived I had forgotten to print out the voucher, no problem said the receptionist, when you get a chance please use the free computer and print it out for us. Lovely people and helped to maek the stay memorable for all the right reasons. Yes the stairs are a bit of an effort if you are on the top floor, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bright, Clean Hotel.. without Elevator”
Reviews.Author: MonZor
Reviews.Content: My mom and I got a really good deal at this hotel on the internet, so I don't have too many complaints. The stairways are very white and pretty - which you notice because there isn't an elevator (so try to get on a lower floor if you don't want to or can't trek up too many stairs). We had a room on the 4th floor (which was hard to walk up to after a long day of sightseeing), but it was a lot brighter than the other floors. The air conditioning worked well enough, and the room was clean. It was nice to have white tiled floors in the immense heat, and the beds were comfortable enough. The rooms could use some updating - like many hotels in Rome. But, unlike many hotels in central locations, its quiet and doesn't have much street traffic. It's in the old Jewish Ghetto, which is now a bustling community close to the Campo dei Fiori, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The staff was really nice and let us check in super early. They also had a free computer with internet for guests. Continental breakfast was abundant, and the lady in the breakfast room makes amazing coffee and cappucinos.

Reviews.Title: “HOTel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MsLea
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel with a central location. Most activites can be reached by walking. It isn't all that close to a train stop so I would suggest a cab ride. No elevator. They let us leave our bag before check in and after check out which was nice. Hotel was clean and fresh looking. Breakfast had pastry but also cereal, yogury and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--good value”
Reviews.Author: JenGarBar
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price. All we needed was a bed and bathroom, so this worked. The bed was actually two twins pushed together, but they were fine. We didn't have breakfast there so I can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kcclan
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 2 nights at the Hotel Arenula. The only positive thing I can say is that the location of the hotel was close enough to most of the sights we wanted to visit. We were disappointed in the hotel staff. They were quite rude. We were even more disappointed in our room. The furnishings were quite sparse and the plaster on the bathroom walls and ceiling were peeling. In fact large chunks of plaster fell from the ceiling while we were there. We complained to the management but to no avail. I would definitely not recommend wasting your money at the Hotel Arenula.

Reviews.Title: “Fatastic location”
Reviews.Author: SusLau
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Hotel Arenula, Perfect location, 10 minutes from Pantheon - 5 minutes from Campo Fiori, Nice and very clean room - all the hotel people were very helpfull and always smiling, breakfast good - we will for sure stay there again the next time we go to this marvellous city.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do...”
Reviews.Author: VancouverGirl45
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September 2007 and I found, overall, that the pros outweighed the cons, but only marginally. On the plus side, the room was very spacious (a double bed, two singles and a big bathroom) the location was good for walking everywhere, there were plenty of cheap eats nearby and we loved the close proximity to the Ghetto and the Campo di Fiori, which were a lot of fun. On the down side, the place is styled and lit like a rec centre, the breakfast (though good) was overcrowded with tour groups and the front desk service was, at best, indifferent. We were traveling with a baby and this was the only place in 7 B&B's and hostels that we went to that did not have a crib or any baby amenities, so come prepared. I think there must be better places out there, but because of the location and room size, I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good low-budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandybeth
Reviews.Content: For what it is, Hotel Arenula is great. Don't expect fancy digs - it's strictly tiled floors, with bathrooms hardly large enough to swing a cat, and two single beds pushed together to make doubles like everywhere in Italy - but it's clean, neat and the staff are very friendly. The breakfast room is very small, and that's a real disadvantage - you have to book a time. However, the location is brilliant, close to everything. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: P0llyB
Reviews.Content: Although the location and price of this hotel are excellent, and the breakfast was ample, there is no elevator, and a rather steep climb on winding stairways. You have to climb to the second floor for the reception desk and, although we had requested a low floor, we were originally put on the fourth floor.....a real hardship for seniors. We were moved to the third eventually, but even that was a problem. with or without luggage!! There is also a lot of street noise from the trams which pass quite often. We were, however, able to walk everywhere from this location. There is no internet access at the hotel, but two close internet points nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location to do the sights”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: small family run hotel in great location. no lift so be careful with lots of baggage! We paid for the previous night as we arrived on a very early flight only to find the room had been sold. We did get to check in about 9am [without charge] but we had two e-mails confirming the arrnagement. The lady on the desk was agrump but we found all the other reception staff to be great.. Breakfast was great, rooms simple and tidy. Very quiet location for centre of room, trams run nearby but just a distant rumble. bathroom small but OK. I'd score it 6.5 out of 10. We paid Euro95

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Tycochphil
Reviews.Content: As in previous reviews i can confirm cleanliness, excellent continental breakfast, especially the bread rolls, very convenient location for all the major attractions. Two slight downsides, the stairs (no lift) and the early morning traffic noise especially from the trams. Very reasonable cost, we were there for the Italy v Wales rugby match for 3 nights and paid about £250

Reviews.Title: “If only the staff were more helpful”
Reviews.Author: Joe&Carrie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Arenula for 3 nights in October. The location was ideal as others have mentioned and the price was reasonable. The breakfast each morning was good - cereal, crossants, yogurt, juice, coffee, fruit, crakers, etc. The hotel itself smelled clean. The bathroom and the room itself appeared clean. The room itself was pretty basic but we knew that when we booked and that's what we paid for. Things were great until we went to bed for the first time and realized that our bed reeked of urine! The sheets looked very fresh and clean - it must have been in the mattress. My husband expressed our dissatisfaction to the housekeeping woman on his was down to the desk and after several minutes of going back and forth she explained that the smell that we were smelling was not infact urine but rather perfume that must have soaked into the mattress from the last guest. What an insult! We know the difference between the smell of ammonia and perfume! When we told her this and asked for a new mattress she said that she would communicate to the manager but that she is not allowed to rotate mattresses between rooms. Sure enough, this was ultimately the final response that came from the front desk. The additional "help" that we got in solving this matter was the advice to open the windows and air it out. Had we not had the poor experience with the urine soaked mattress, I would recommend this hotel as an average place to stay. Nothing overly impressive but a perfect spot to sleep and shower while touring Rome. Even if the staff would have just addressed our problem, we would have been comfortable recommending this hotel but since they didn't all we can say is that we hope you don't get the same room we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!!!”
Reviews.Author: biggurl2
Reviews.Content: I am a single female traveller who stayed at this hotel Sept 21-25. My first impression was the cleanliness of my room. It is in a very central location to many of the tourists attractions - minutes away from the Pantheon and surrounding restaurants, Trastavere, about a 20 minute walk to the Vatican (if you so desire or the bus stops is a couple of blocks away), Collesum, the Palantine area and it goes on. I originally booked near the train station but my friend who stayed earlier this year persuaded me to book here and I have no regrets even though it was more than my original booking. The breakfast is substantial and the women are very effecient in providing prompt service. They provide bread, fruits, cheese, coffee,tea, milk, cereal. Perhaps the only problem I see is they do not have an elevator so one must be able to walk up stairs with bags if booking this hotel. Two flights of stairs are a minimum. This hotel was mentioned in Rick Steve's Rome 2006 travel book. Front desk service individuals are somewhat helpful but all are cordial and professional. I will absolutely stay here again and recommend it for anyone who is planning to see Rome and are on a budget. I have done my research and this hotel is definitely well priced for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: SactoJD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning and the end of our recent Italian trip. Nice place, but far from all metro stops. Located in the Jewish Ghetto, it is walking distance to Campo Fiori, Trastevere, and nearby bus stops. Our first room, on the third floor, was very nice. Old fashioned double door entry (with sticky locks) and nice views of red tiled rooftops. This floor also offered the traditional Italian clothesline out the window. Our second room was one floor up. This floor had been somewhat remodeled. They had traditional hotel doors, but the bathroom door had been replaced by a collapsing screen. Also, the clothesline was gone. I never saw, or heard mention of, an elevator, so be forewarned if you are steps-weary. The breakfast buffet was very good. The coffee was nice and strong, and the baked goods were a delight. Combined with a nice additional selection at the buffet, it was a good way to start the day. Staff was also pleasant. They helped us with many different things (reservations, restaurants, airport shuttles.) They all spoke English and were perfectly tolerant of our iffy Italian. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Low Key & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ed VV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an alley in the Jewish Ghetto. It is centrally located and walkable to most of the major attractions. It was a 15 minute walk to the Forum or Colesseum, 10 minutes to Piazza Navona, and 20 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. The air conditioning worked like US hotels.....we were there in the middle of a Roman heat wave (90+F). The room was large by European standards, about the size of a standard US hotel room. Don't expect fancy digs; the Arenula is not fancy. But it was clean and functional, the staff was friendly, and breakfast was good. A number of US college students (the ages of our children) were staying there while attending a language school. The kids were nice. The only drawback was there is no elevator. We opted to stay on the 2nd floor in order to avoid lots of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Yves
Reviews.Content: Hello, The Arenula hotel is quoted as a 2 star hotel. But i stayed in 3-star hotels elsewhere where they had even less comfort. So i guess this hotel deserves a bit more than 2 stars. The rooms were done every day and we got fresh towels daily. The airco in the room worked properly. We didn't use it too much because it wasn't always that hot. We slept with our window open at night and we didn't find it difficult to fall asleep. So, no big noises at night in that street! In the morning we had a good breakfast. Make sure you go pretty early, we went at 9 am and both breakfast rooms were full .. We only had to wait for 15 minutes and everything was well organised for that waiting. Breakffast is simple but good. You get 2 pieces of bread (including a croissant or other pastry) per person. Further on you have a choice of different kind of jam, chocolate, cookies, cornflakes, ...... they serve tea or coffee at your table. If you want cold milk or orange juice, they have that too ! The only minus is the 4 floors with no elevator. Luckily enough i could stay on the 1st floor, because i emailed them first :) I surely would recommend this hotel also because it is situated near the center. Only a 10-15 minute walk to the pantheon and trevi. A 15 min. walk to collos. and so on .. we never had to use public transport to get around !. When you leave the hotel, go to the left in the Via Arenula, cross the bridge and pick a good restaruant in Trastevere. They have a big selection of good, cosy and not too expensive family run restaurants. Me want pizza now !!!!! :)))) later all !

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Jeroen_D
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome from 17th till 21st July 2006. We were looking for a hotel which had to be centrally located and we only needed breakfast. Visiting Rome means walking a lot so we expected to be tired in the evening thus requiring a good bed. Well, we loved Arenula. It's close to the vivid Piazza di Navona and Campo dei Fiori. The bed was firm and very comfortable. The breakfast was more than satisfactory. The hotel personnel was very friendly, helpful at the desk and maintenance switched sheets and towels practically every day. Also worth mentioning is the fact that we weren't disturbed by any noise at night. The only minus we can think of are the stairs. We were on the top floor (4th) and there is no elevator. Luckily the stairs are big and we only used them in the morning and the evening. A perfect hotel for a city trip! Jeroen & Sofie

Reviews.Title: “a sound choice if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: stpe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location, on the tram line, and an easy walk to colloseum, campo d'fiori, piazza navona, Trastevere area. It's also close to Trastevere train station, which is handy if you're coming from fuimuciano airport as you can take the train to Trastevere station then a cab or tram to the hotel. There are good eating places nearby. I liked the area as it's not as flooded with tourists as up round Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain area. The hotel has a lovely spiral staircase up to the rooms and rooms are tidy and clean. Our room had a balcony but it simply looked out on other buildings, had no seating, was dirty and very unappealing. We were only there for 2 nights so didn't really need any outdoor area. If we'd been staying longer, I would have preferred a hotel with a rooftop garden area, as it gives you somewhere to chill out and get away from the busy-ness of Rome. I booked this hotel via their website and requested a 2+1 room. However, we were only booked in for a double room. I should have checked the hotel's confirmation email more carefully. Upon arrival, we had to live with the double room for the first night and they were happy to move us to a more appropriate room for the following night. The website for this hotel is a bit temperamental and you can't always get into it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Arenula”
Reviews.Author: DCS2009
Reviews.Content: At 125 Euros a night for a double room, this hotel was very average. Although the location was central for seeing Rome on foot, it was a good 25 minute walk from the nearest Metro station. Breakfast was served from 7 - 9.40am, basic quality food, and a little too early for the average tourist. Room 414 on the fourth floor, I didn't mind it being on the 4th floor but some might. The room itself had air conditioning that when left on 24/7 gave a temparature of 24 degrees C. The shower room (no bath) door was a concertina door that didn't exactly allow for privacy. All in all the location was good, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Arenula”
Reviews.Author: fishyflier
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Arenula. We couldn't have been happier. The room was sparkly clean. The bathroom was small but no big deal. I can't say enough about the outstanding air conditioning. The staff was friendly, the breakfasts were substantial and the location was perfect - right in the middle of everything. I would definately stay there again and again. Who needs a mini-bar when you can have a great place to stay at an excellent price. And try the Ristorante S. Anna just down the block and across the street - the best meal I had in Rome. And I ate a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ-LongIsland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 8 nights at the Hotel Arenula (May 6 - May 14). This hotel has an excellent location, is very clean, the bed was nice and firm, and the staff was helpful! The hotel is just a short walk from many popular places - the Campo D'Fiori, Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, the Pantheon, and many others. The main tourist bus (64 and/or 40) is only a few blocks away. As for the breakfast - it is a typical European (continental) breakfast. Every morning there were fresh rolls, sweet rolls, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee/tea, cereal, bread, crackers. Yes, there were times when you had to wait for a table, but that was usually after 9:00 and we only waited a few minutes - it really wasn't that big a deal. The reception desk has bus tickets available, and were great with directions and advising which bus to take. The room was a regular size for Rome, and it was exceptionally clean! Everyday the room was cleaned - there wasn't dust or dirt anywhere!! All I can say is this was a very nice hotel - convenient, clean, and reasonably priced. We would definitely suggest it to anyone, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as everyone else has said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was slightly disapointed to be honest. The reception and stairways as all very nice, but i found my room decidedly small and the shower room poorly finished. It was very clean and quite acceptable but not up to reviews other people had given.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: italophilegirl
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Arenula in Rome. The hotel is ideally located near Campo de'Fiori and Piazza Venezia in the city centre with many bus routes near at hand. It is easily reached by bus from Ciampino Airport to Termini railway station and then a city bus to Torre Argentina. The breakfasts were very filling (croissants, rolls, fresh fruit, yogurts, cereals, biscuits) and the restaurant staff very friendly. Hotel staff were willing to look after our luggage after checkout as our flight back was not until the evening. The hotel is just up the road from the Al Pompiere restaurant, which can be handy if you're tired after travelling. The bedrooms and shower rooms are spotless. Complimentary shower gel, shower caps, and razors were a nice touch. All in all, an ideal place to stay for a break in the Eternal City!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico”
Reviews.Author: gkfld
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very friendly staff. Great location

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: malky-moo-moo
Reviews.Content: Great location, spotless simply-decorated but comfortable room, friendly staff. Easy to get to from FCO airport, train to Trastevere, then a tram to within about 100 yards. Not on a "alley" as described by earlier reviewers. On a small side street, an advantage as traffic noise is less. Earlier reviewers mentioned "peeling paint". Maybe the place has had a face-lift, this was certainly not my impression. Minus points - bit of a climb to the higher floors - no lift. Breakfast room can be busy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Arenula - Wow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay in the hotel. I love the Hotel. The friendly staff looked after us, the front desk staff were again most obliging and helpful and always had time for my wife and I. Its close to every tourist site you'd want to visit and being in the middle of Rome you have a choice of dozens of awesome restaurants, fabulous shops and great coffee bars a minute's walk from the Arenula. Morning breakfasts are really excellent with fresh fruit, bottomless great coffee, fresh tasty croisants, cheeses, cereals, etc. In all honestly I can advise anyone going to Rome to stay in the Hotel whether you are a couple travelling on a romantic trip or a group wanting excellent value being close to all the beautiful sites that the city has to offer. The rooms are spotlessly clean, the water pressure in the showers is strong (unlike the Hilton) and the maids are so friendly you may want to return home with one in your suitcase! Forget paying hundreds/thousands more Dollars on accomodation - spend more on shopping and have a comfortable stay in an authentic Roman hotel. Lance. Johannesburg South Africa

Reviews.Title: “breakfast and location”
Reviews.Author: dvaughn971
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good value in the center of Rome, then this is your place. It's easy walking distance to all the major sites, except the Vatican, and there is a major bus stop just up the street that will get you to the train station. The Trastevere neighborhood is just across the river, and there are interesting shops and great restaurants over there. The hotel has many stairs and no elevator, but the rooms are large, and the breakfast in the morning is satisfying. The staff was not particularly charming, and there was no fluent English spoken, but then again, we really didn't require any assistance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Great location, room and bathroom clean (if a little outdated in decor!) and a good size, bed comfortable, all the usual satellite TV channels (BBC World, CNN, Eurosport, etc.). I'd recommend this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights here. The hotel is in a good location, not far from Campo di Fiori on the one side, and on the other, the Colosseum. The rooms are not big, but fit a king bed, dresser, and small desk. There is no elevator. The breakfast was good, but they didn't have enough seating for all the guests, which was a bit of a pain. The english Herald-Tribune newspaper was available for free in the lobby. The price was about 120 Euro. Not a lot of charm to the place, but for that price and location, I think you can't do much better in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DeltaNeal
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Arenula for 4 nights in July , while the room could have done with a coat of paint, the room and bathroom were very clean and thankfully the air conditioning worked fine as July in Rome was hot as usual. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the included continental breakfasts were very good with lots of choices. I thoroughly enjoyed my espressos and cappacinos each morning. Location is excellent , walking distance to many sights including a 10 min. walk across the Pont Garibaldi to the Tresteverde district with plenty of great restaurants. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Roma.

HotelInfo.Name: Arenula
HotelInfo.Address: Via Santa Maria dei Calderari 47 | off Via Arenula, 00186 Rome, Italy
